channel.title: Rundll.exe problem
channel.description:
hi everyone my family friends gave there computer to fix it. i have found that it had a rundll.exe problem. i tried searching but didn't go now where.
they have some important stuff in it and they said they don't want to copy it on an external hard drive so i can reformat it.
meanwhile i tried installing all the anti virus softwares and other program (took them off now) there ware no good. if u click the control panel and in the control panel click add or remove programs or any of the list and or if you click the clock an error massage will be displayed with the massage in the picture.
the computer is running windows xp home edition SP2.
if you click on the image you can see a print shot of the error massage
can anyone please help me or advise me what to do.

item.title: Rundll.exe problem
item.dc:creator: @happy_world happy_world
item.description:
@happy_world wrote:

[quote=“Cruzer, post:7, topic:212672”]Is it an HP with a Recovery hard drive?

Check by going into my computer, there should be a drive named “recovery”[/quote]

unfortunately there hard drive broke down and they bought a new hard drive. so now the don’t have the recovery

Read full topic

item.title: Rundll.exe problem
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

rundll is just a host process to run at DLL starting at a specified entrypoint. For example, to open your Desktop Settings, you could run
RUNDLL32.EXE SHELL32.DLL,Control_RunDLL desk.cpl,0
It’s legitimate, assuming malware hasn’t deleted it then renamed itself as rundll32.exe.

Read full topic

item.title: Rundll.exe problem
item.dc:creator: @Cruzer Cruzer
item.description:
@Cruzer wrote:

Is it an HP with a Recovery hard drive?

Check by going into my computer, there should be a drive named “recovery”

Read full topic

item.title: Rundll.exe problem
item.dc:creator: @happy_world happy_world
item.description:
@happy_world wrote:

ok from where this error is coming from. the computer came with windows XP. ITs a HP computer. Last time when i reformat that computer for them, I reinstalled the operating system. and then i installed SP2.
and i checked on my computer i have rundll.exe running beautifully but this computer don’t now from where it came from.

there anyway to fix it besides reformatting

Read full topic

item.title: Rundll.exe problem
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

I have rundll running in XP and have had for years.

Read full topic

item.title: Rundll.exe problem
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

Greeny:

But I can tell you it isn’t a virus

iirc it’s a windows process in win95-2000, but in xp it’s malicious.

Read full topic
